jfortes module¶

class jfortes.Jfortes[source]¶

Bases: object

Jfortes class is adopted as a main start point of the tool. In this class is controlled the flow of the JFORTES method, which has the following steps:

  • (1) Execution of ESC/JAVA;
  • (2) Beatify code (preprocesing);
  • (3) Execution of ESC/JAVA (this is to keep the track the original line number);
  • (4) Properties translation that is executed to convert the assertions from ESC/JAVA to assertion to be executed in java programs;
  • (5) Test cases creation that is set the properties translate in asserts according to framework adopted by the user;
  • (6) Apply the unit test framework model (TestNG, JCUTE, or only java asserts) choose by the user
  • (7) Execution the tests
delete_tmp_files()[source]¶

This method remove all temporary files generated by Jfortes class that are saved in the global var self.list_tmp_files

Returns:void, the method only remove the files
gather_data_claims(_escJavaOutPut, _nameextension)[source]¶

Gather the data from claims generated by ESC/Java

Parameters:
  • _escJavaOutPut (str) – The output from ESC/Java
  • _nameextension (str) – The file extension where the data gathered will be saved
Returns:

The CSV file with the data gathered from ESC/Java output

 
>>> self.gather_data_claims("/tmp/file.escout","_before_pre_claims.csv")
generate_data2input(_javafile)[source]¶

This method call our java parser that identifies the attributes and the input args of the methods in the analyzed program, and then the parser creates a list that has: (1) the variables name; (2) the type of the variables; and (3) the line number where the variable is located in the code.

Parameters:_javafile (str) – The file path to analyzed program
Returns: 
>>> runJfortes.generate_data2input(os.path.abspath("tests/Bag.java"))
insert_claims(_javafile, _claimstranslatedfile, _datainputfile)[source]¶

This method creates a new instance of the analyzed program, and then it adds in this new instance asserts with properties generated by ESC/JAVA. It is woth noting that in this point the variable self.dic_model_unit_test was defined with the name of the framework that user choose.

Parameters:
  • _javafile – The file path to the analyzed program
  • _claimstranslatedfile – The file path to the translated properties
  • _datainputfile – The csv file path generated by the method generate_data2input
Returns:

void, this because the method only generates the new program
load_java_path(javafile, javaClassPath)[source]¶

This method loads the java file to run ESC/Java

Parameters:
  • javafile (str) – The path of the java file.
  • javaClassPath (str) – Java class path to run java programs.
Returns:

The file path that has the ESC/Java execution execution.

 
>>> runJfortes.load_java_path(os.path.abspath("/tests/Bag.java"), "/usr/lib/java/jdk1.5.0_22/bin/java")
pre_processing(_javafile, _pathtoprefile, _mode)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • _javafile – The path of the java file
  • _pathtoprefile – The path to save the java file preprocessed
  • _mode (bool) – True to write the code preprocessed
Returns:

void, this because this method only write the code preprocessed in a new file
run_esc_java(_javafile, _nameextension)[source]¶

This method executes the ESC/Java that receives as input the javafile, and then it saves the ESC/Java output in the <file>.escout

Parameters:
  • _javafile – The path of the java file
  • _nameextension – The file extension where the ESC/JAVA output will be java
Type:

__javafile: str
Type:

__nameextension: str
Returns:

The the path file that has the ESC/Java output

 
>>> self.run_esc_java(os.path.abspath("/tests/Bag.java"),".escout")
translate_claims(claimsFile)[source]¶

This method translated the properties generated by ESC/JAVA. This translation is to generate an assertion to be executed in java code out of the ESC/JAVA flow.

Parameters:claimsFile (str) – The path of the file with the ESC/JAVA properties
Returns:The file path with the properties translated
